verses.text_plain: And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
verses.verse_html: 1And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 2And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.

tokens.text: And it came to pass in the third

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto his servants, Know ye that Ramoth in Gilead is ours, and we be still, and take it not out of the hand of the king of Syria?
verses.verse_html:
3And the king of Israel said unto his servants, Know ye that Ramoth in Gilead is ours, and we be still, and take it not out of the hand of the king of Syria? ▼
▼ still…: Heb. silent from taking it

tokens.text: it not out of the hand

footnotes.body_text: ▼ still…: Heb. silent from taking it
footnotes.body_html: ▼ still…: Heb. silent from taking it

verses.text_plain: And he said unto Jehoshaphat, Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramoth–gilead? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.
verses.verse_html: 4And he said unto Jehoshaphat, Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramoth–gilead? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord to day.
verses.verse_html: 5And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord to day.

tokens.text: I pray thee, at the word

verses.text_plain: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.verse_html: 6Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the Lord besides, that we might enquire of him?
verses.verse_html: 7And Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the Lord besides, that we might enquire of him?

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, Micaiah the son of Imlah, by whom we may enquire of the Lord: but I hate him; for he doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
verses.verse_html: 8And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, Micaiah the son of Imlah, by whom we may enquire of the Lord: but I hate him; for he doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.

tokens.text: him; for he doth not prophesy

verses.text_plain: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Hasten hither Micaiah the son of Imlah.
verses.verse_html:
9Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Hasten hither Micaiah the son of Imlah. ▼
▼ officer: or, eunuch

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, having put on their robes, in a void place in the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
verses.verse_html:
10And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, having put on their robes, in a void place in the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them. ▼
▼ void…: Heb. floor

verses.text_plain: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron: and he said, Thus saith the Lord, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until thou have consumed them.
verses.verse_html: 11And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron: and he said, Thus saith the Lord, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until thou have consumed them.

verses.text_plain: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth–gilead, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the king’s hand.
verses.verse_html: 12And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth–gilead, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the king’s hand.

verses.text_plain: And the messenger that was gone to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good unto the king with one mouth: let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak that which is good.
verses.verse_html: 13And the messenger that was gone to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good unto the king with one mouth: let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak that which is good.

tokens.text: I pray thee, be like the word

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, As the Lord liveth, what the Lord saith unto me, that will I speak.
verses.verse_html: 14And Micaiah said, As the Lord liveth, what the Lord saith unto me, that will I speak.

tokens.text: unto me, that will I speak

verses.text_plain: So he came to the king. And the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go against Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall we forbear? And he answered him, Go, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.verse_html: 15So he came to the king. And the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go against Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall we forbear? And he answered him, Go, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou tell me nothing but that which is true in the name of the Lord?
verses.verse_html: 16And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou tell me nothing but that which is true in the name of the Lord?

verses.text_plain: And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the hills, as sheep that have not a shepherd: and the Lord said, These have no master: let them return every man to his house in peace.
verses.verse_html: 17And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the hills, as sheep that have not a shepherd: and the Lord said, These have no master: let them return every man to his house in peace.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would prophesy no good concerning me, but evil?
verses.verse_html: 18And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would prophesy no good concerning me, but evil?

verses.text_plain: And he said, Hear thou therefore the word of the Lord: I saw the Lord sitting on his throne, and all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.
verses.verse_html: 19And he said, Hear thou therefore the word of the Lord: I saw the Lord sitting on his throne, and all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.

tokens.text: by him on his right hand

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said, Who shall persuade Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth–gilead? And one said on this manner, and another said on that manner.
verses.verse_html:
20And the Lord said, Who shall persuade Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth–gilead? And one said on this manner, and another said on that manner. ▼
▼ persuade: or, deceive

verses.text_plain: And there came forth a spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said, I will persuade him.
verses.verse_html: 21And there came forth a spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said, I will persuade him.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto him, Wherewith? And he said, I will go forth, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shalt persuade him, and prevail also: go forth, and do so.
verses.verse_html: 22And the Lord said unto him, Wherewith? And he said, I will go forth, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shalt persuade him, and prevail also: go forth, and do so.

tokens.text: unto him, Wherewith? And he said
and I will be a lying

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil concerning thee.
verses.verse_html: 23Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil concerning thee.

verses.text_plain: But Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near, and smote Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord from me to speak unto thee?
verses.verse_html: 24But Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near, and smote Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord from me to speak unto thee?

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see in that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
verses.verse_html:
25And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see in that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself. ▼
▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber

footnotes.body_text: ▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber
footnotes.body_html: ▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.verse_html: 26And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;

verses.text_plain: And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.
verses.verse_html: 27And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, the Lord hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, O people, every one of you.
verses.verse_html: 28And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, the Lord hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, O people, every one of you.

verses.text_plain: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth–gilead.
verses.verse_html: 29So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth–gilead.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and enter into the battle; but put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself, and went into the battle.
verses.verse_html:
30And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and enter into the battle; but put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself, and went into the battle. ▼
▼ I will…: or, when he was to disguise himself, and enter into the battle

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I will…: or, when he was to disguise himself, and enter into the battle
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I will…: or, when he was to disguise himself, and enter into the battle

verses.text_plain: But the king of Syria commanded his thirty and two captains that had rule over his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 31But the king of Syria commanded his thirty and two captains that had rule over his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.

tokens.text: that had rule over his chariots

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel. And they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.
verses.verse_html: 32And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel. And they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the captains

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
verses.verse_html: 33And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the captains

verses.text_plain: And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot, Turn thine hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
verses.verse_html:
34And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot, Turn thine hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am wounded. ▼
▼ at a…: Heb. in his simplicity
 , ▼
▼ joints…: Heb. joints and the breastplate
 , ▼
▼ wounded: Heb. made sick

tokens.text: unto the driver of his chariot

footnotes.body_text: ▼ at a…: Heb. in his simplicity
footnotes.body_html: ▼ at a…: Heb. in his simplicity

footnotes.body_text: ▼ joints…: Heb. joints and the breastplate
footnotes.body_html: ▼ joints…: Heb. joints and the breastplate
▼ wounded: Heb. made sick

verses.text_plain: And the battle increased that day: and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians, and died at even: and the blood ran out of the wound into the midst of the chariot.
verses.verse_html:
35And the battle increased that day: and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians, and died at even: and the blood ran out of the wound into the midst of the chariot. ▼
▼ increased: Heb. ascended
 , ▼
▼ midst: Heb. bosom

verses.text_plain: And there went a proclamation throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his own country.
verses.verse_html: 36And there went a proclamation throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his own country.

verses.text_plain: So the king died, and was brought to Samaria; and they buried the king in Samaria.
verses.verse_html:
37So the king died, and was brought to Samaria; and they buried the king in Samaria. ▼
▼ was brought: Heb. came

footnotes.body_html: ▼ was brought: Heb. came

verses.text_plain: And one washed the chariot in the pool of Samaria; and the dogs licked up his blood; and they washed his armour; according unto the word of the Lord which he spake.
verses.verse_html: 38And one washed the chariot in the pool of Samaria; and the dogs licked up his blood; and they washed his armour; according unto the word of the Lord which he spake.

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, and the ivory house which he made, and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.verse_html: 39Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, and the ivory house which he made, and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.text_plain: So Ahab slept with his fathers; and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 40So Ahab slept with his fathers; and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 41And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.

verses.text_plain: Jehoshaphat was thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.verse_html: 42Jehoshaphat was thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.

verses.text_plain: And he walked in all the ways of Asa his father; he turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of the Lord: nevertheless the high places were not taken away; for the people offered and burnt incense yet in the high places.
verses.verse_html: 43And he walked in all the ways of Asa his father; he turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of the Lord: nevertheless the high places were not taken away; for the people offered and burnt incense yet in the high places.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 44And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he shewed, and how he warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.verse_html: 45Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he shewed, and how he warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.text_plain: And the remnant of the sodomites, which remained in the days of his father Asa, he took out of the land.
verses.verse_html: 46And the remnant of the sodomites, which remained in the days of his father Asa, he took out of the land.

verses.text_plain: There was then no king in Edom: a deputy was king.
verses.verse_html: 47There was then no king in Edom: a deputy was king.

verses.text_plain: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at Ezion–geber.
verses.verse_html:
48Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at Ezion–geber. ▼
▼ made…: or, had ten ships

footnotes.body_html: ▼ made…: or, had ten ships

verses.text_plain: Then said Ahaziah the son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not.
verses.verse_html: 49Then said Ahaziah the son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 50And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.

verses.text_plain: Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned two years over Israel.
verses.verse_html: 51Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned two years over Israel.

verses.text_plain: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin:
verses.verse_html: 52And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin:

verses.text_plain: For he served Baal, and worshipped him, and provoked to anger the Lord God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.
verses.verse_html: 53For he served Baal, and worshipped him, and provoked to anger the Lord God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.

tokens.text: according to all that his father
